Author: meatspoon#7860
Content: and its also why central banks claim that deflation is bad... as if its bad that your dollar buys more this year than last.  Deflation is great for the consumer, saver, prudent adult.  Deflation is awful for central banks and governments, because they can't run up spending and debt.

Author: passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã#0622
Content: Hmm  if I udnerstand correctly the crash comes due to very big miss-trust of collected debt. Debt is created as promise. I promise you to deliver if you pay me now. You pay now, I just promise to deliver later, and there is the paper. Also is is chained. I deliver if other guys who promised me to deliver will do that later. Then in time some % of such deals comes to default. All good until those papers are not being traded - these debts can be hidden and stashed. A casino game, But in the end few or none players understand who got shited during the game. Sth like this I see. Here blockchain (public leadger) could help clarify where is the problematic debt maybe? Right now if understand problem is there are papers over papers, not so public and not easy to check - not digital. Does it make any sense what I wright? :pirate:
